title: Eliminate a Variable
text: The y's are already opposites so they will be eliminated once we add up the two equations. $$x+y=-8$$ $$x-y=-6$$

title: Add the Equations to Eliminate One Variable
text: Add the x's, y's, and constants. y will be eliminated and then solve for x. $$2x=-14$$ $$x=-7$$

title: Substitute Solution into Original Equations
text: Substitute $$x=-7$$ into the first equation, $$x+y=-7$$. Then solve for y. $$x+y=-8$$ $$\left(-7\right)+y=-8$$ $$y=-1$$

title: Solution as Ordered Pair
text: Solution to the system of equations is (-7,-1).
